unnormalised: The relentless monsoon rains had been battering Mumbai for days, turning streets into rivers and testing the city's infrastructure to its limits. But it was the incident at Om Shanti Apartments, located at Flat No. 201, 2nd Floor, Saiwadi, Borivali (West), Mumbai, Maharashtra, Pincode: 400092 that captured the city's attention.
normalised: The relentless monsoon rains had been battering Mumbai for days, turning streets into rivers and testing the city's infrastructure to its limits. But it was the incident at Om Shanti Apartments, located at Flat Number two hundred and one, second Floor, Saiwadi, Borivali (West), Mumbai, Maharashtra, Pincode: four hundred thousand ninety two that captured the city's attention.

unnormalised: Early Tuesday morning, residents woke to a scene of chaos. Part of the building's facade had crumbled, leaving gaping holes and exposing the inner walls. Initial reports pointed to structural weakness exacerbated by the incessant rain as the primary cause.
normalised: Early Tuesday morning, residents woke to a scene of chaos. Part of the building's facade had crumbled, leaving gaping holes and exposing the inner walls. Initial reports pointed to structural weakness exacerbated by the incessant rain as the primary cause.

unnormalised: "I heard a loud rumble around 4:00 AM," recounted Mrs. Patel, a resident of Flat 102. "It sounded like thunder, but the whole building shook. I looked out the window and saw the damage. It was terrifying."
normalised: "I heard a loud rumble around four zero zero A-M," recounted Missus Patel, a resident of Flat one hundred and two. "It sounded like thunder, but the whole building shook. I looked out the window and saw the damage. It was terrifying."

unnormalised: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) was immediately alerted and dispatched a team to assess the situation. Preliminary inspections revealed that several flats, including Flat 305, 3rd Floor, and Flat 101, 1st Floor, had sustained significant damage and were deemed unsafe for habitation.
normalised: The B-M-C was immediately alerted and dispatched a team to assess the situation. Preliminary inspections revealed that several flats, including Flat three hundred and five, third Floor, and Flat one hundred and one, first Floor, had sustained significant damage and were deemed unsafe for habitation.

unnormalised: Residents were evacuated to a nearby community hall, their lives upended in an instant. The address of the temporary shelter was hastily announced: Community Hall, Near Ganesh Mandir, L.T. Road, Borivali (West), Mumbai - 400103. Volunteers and local NGOs rushed to provide assistance, distributing food, water, and blankets.
normalised: Residents were evacuated to a nearby community hall, their lives upended in an instant. The address of the temporary shelter was hastily announced: Community Hall, Near Ganesh Mandir, L-T Road, Borivali (West), Mumbai - four hundred thousand one hundred and three. Volunteers and local N-G-Os rushed to provide assistance, distributing food, water, and blankets.

unnormalised: The building's owner, Mr. Rajesh Khanna, residing at Bungalow No. 12, Hill View Estate, Kandivali (East), Mumbai, 400101, expressed his shock and dismay. "I am deeply saddened by what has happened," he said in a statement. "We will cooperate fully with the authorities to ensure the safety and well-being of all residents. I am at my residence and coordinating with all relevant authorities so as to give necessary information as and when required. Please note the same and cooperate."
normalised: The building's owner, Mister Rajesh Khanna, residing at Bungalow Number twelve, Hill View Estate, Kandivali (East), Mumbai, four hundred thousand one hundred and one, expressed his shock and dismay. "I am deeply saddened by what has happened," he said in a statement. "We will cooperate fully with the authorities to ensure the safety and well-being of all residents. I am at my residence and coordinating with all relevant authorities so as to give necessary information as and when required. Please note the same and cooperate."

unnormalised: The incident has raised serious questions about the condition of aging buildings across Mumbai and the effectiveness of the city's building regulations. Experts have warned that many more buildings are vulnerable, particularly in areas like Dadar (West), Pincode: 400028, and Colaba, Mumbai, 400005, where buildings are decades old and haven't seen adequate maintenance.
normalised: The incident has raised serious questions about the condition of aging buildings across Mumbai and the effectiveness of the city's building regulations. Experts have warned that many more buildings are vulnerable, particularly in areas like Dadar (West), Pincode: four hundred thousand twenty eight, and Colaba, Mumbai, four hundred thousand five, where buildings are decades old and haven't seen adequate maintenance.

unnormalised: The BMC has launched a comprehensive survey of all buildings older than 30 years to identify those at risk. The survey will cover various factors, including structural integrity, material quality, and adherence to building codes. The address for reporting any concerns to the BMC has been shared widely: Disaster Management Cell, BMC Headquarters, Fort, Mumbai, 400001.
normalised: The B-M-C has launched a comprehensive survey of all buildings older than thirty years to identify those at risk. The survey will cover various factors, including structural integrity, material quality, and adherence to building codes. The address for reporting any concerns to the B-M-C has been shared widely: Disaster Management Cell, B-M-C Headquarters, Fort, Mumbai, four hundred thousand one.
